title: Contributing to bisonpicsuite
text: want make bigger change, ’s good idea first file issue make sure someone team agrees ’s needed. ’ve found bug, please file issue illustrates bug minimal reprex (also help write unit test, needed).

title: Contributing to bisonpicsuite
text: Fork package clone onto computer. haven’t done , recommend using usethis::create_from_github("", fork = TRUE). Install development dependences devtools::install_dev_deps(), make sure package passes R CMD check running devtools::check(). R CMD check doesn’t pass cleanly, ’s good idea ask help continuing. Create Git branch pull request (PR). recommend using usethis::pr_init("brief-description--change"). Make changes, commit git, create PR running usethis::pr_push(), following prompts browser. title PR briefly describe change. body PR contain Fixes #issue-number. Begin commit merge messages - indicate user facing changes included NEWS.md. use fledge automatically generate NEWS.md file.

title: Contributing to bisonpicsuite
text: New code follow tidyverse style guide. can use styler package apply styles, please don’t restyle code nothing PR. use roxygen2, Markdown syntax, documentation. use testthat unit tests. Contributions test cases included easier accept.

title: User Guide for shinybisonpic and runbisonpic Apps
text: Alberta Environment Protected Areas piloting use remote game cameras monitor herd composition wood bison. Three R packages developed work together achieve goal. underlying functionality bisonpictools, package functions clean, process, model, visualize data. two R packages apps provide user friendly interface bisonpictools. first app shinybisonpic allows users explore data viewing locations cameras ratios selected sex-age groups. second app runbisonpic allows users run model calculate abundance class, total abundance, survival, fecundity, various sex-age ratios.

Model results won’t accurate, mode helpful first running model ensure everything running correctly. Run includes 2 chains 10 iterations. full run model. mode take much longer quick mode. Run includes 3 chains 500 iterations. Verbose output debugging. Use mode errors occurring help needed. Read messages printed Console RStudio determine going . Run includes 2 chains 10 iterations.

title: User Guide for shinybisonpic and runbisonpic Apps
text: n Sample size. K Number parameter terms model. nchains number chains. niters Number iterations. count number simulations save per chain. nthin Setting nthin = 1 corresponds keeping values. value nthin = 100 result keeping every 100th value discarding values. suggested starting values 1 quick/debug mode 10 report mode. ess Effective sample size (ess). number independent samples estimation power n auto-correlated samples. Measure much independent information auto correlated chains. Doubling thinning rate doubles ess. rhat ratio variances compares - within-chain estimates model parameters. Evaluates whether chains agreed values. total variance chains shrinks average variance within chains, r-hat approaches 1 (close 1 ideal). converged Determines whether model chains agreed values. indicates model converged. model must converge results considered accurate. indicates model converge. model run different parameters data model converges. Results may accurate model converge.

text: Figure 16. Results tab shows results model run. Usage () Select Results tab. (B) Explore Plots. (C) Select plot. (D) Download png plot. (E) Explore Tables. (F) Select table. (G) Download csv table. Results following results reported single point time study year (study years begin April 1). chosen March 31st, represents stable point population, right start calving season. Predicts abundances class study year. Predicts total herd abundance study year, sum predicted abundances class. Predicts survival rates class study year. Bull survival corresponds M2, M3, MA classes. Predicts fecundity rate proportion reproductive cows. Predicts following ratios study year: M0:F0, M1:F1, Calf:FA, Yearling:FA, M2:FA, M3:FA, MA:FA. Table Features can use search bar search filter table specific values. number rows displayed can adjusted changing number Show drop . view rows data can click Next Previous buttons bottom table. title: Getting Started with bisonpicsuite
text: order install R (R Core Team 2023) appropriate binary user’s operating system downloaded CRAN installed. RStudio helpful user interface R, can downloaded . install latest development version bisonpicsuite, execute following code RStudio console. install full suite bisonpic software (see ). Load bisonpic suite packages executing following code
code: install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("poissonconsulting/bisonpicsuite") library(bisonpicsuite) #> Registered S3 method overwritten by 'mcmcr': #>   method         from  #>   as.mcmc.nlists nlist #> Attaching: bisonpictools shinybisonpic runbisonpic bisonpicsuite

title: Getting Started with bisonpicsuite
text: bisonpic suite includes following packages: bisonpictools shinybisonpic runbisonpic bisonpictools provides underlying visualization analysis functionality; shinybisonpic web-based Shiny app provides Graphical User Interface facilitate data visualization exploration, runbisonpic local-based Shiny app set run analysis.

title: Getting Started with bisonpicsuite
text: shinybisonpic runbisonpic Shiny apps, user can download templated excel spreadsheet populate following data tables: event_data contains camera trap event data, including date time event, location camera trap, number individuals class location_data contains coordinates camera traps census_data contains census estimates population aerial surveys, date surveys proportion_calf_data contains estimates proportion calves population aerial surveys, date surveys template contains information required column. uploaded, data checked ensure correct formatting. suggest downloading template one Shiny apps populating , ensure tables correct sheet column names, even user wishes use RStudio console run data visualization /analysis steps.

title: Getting Started with bisonpicsuite
text: Use shinybisonpic Shiny app explore locations camera traps ratios different classes wood bison camera trap observations. Refer user guide information use shinybisonpic app.

title: Getting Started with bisonpicsuite
text: Launch local data analysis app running following lines code RStudio console. See user guide guidance use runbisonpic app.

what: Easily Install and Load `bisonpic` R Packages
title: Easily Install and Load `bisonpic` R Packages
text: goal bisonpicsuite make easy install load bisonpic suite R packages visualizing analyzing wood BISON camera trap (PIC) data. packages designed facilitate data exploration analysis wood bison camera trap data, using underlying functions visualize analyze data (bisonpictools) Shiny applications streamline data visualization (shinybisonpic) data analysis (runbisonpic) processes. data analyzed using Bayesian Integrated Population Model, combines stage-structured population projection matrix model multiple sources data unified framework, allowing estimates age-sex class ratios, population vital rates, abundances, maintaining correct propagation uncertainty. See analytical methods vignette detail modeling approach.
